The king and his retinue dismounted and entered the garden on foot. When King Udayana saw the Buddha from afar, he was overjoyed and could not contain himself. He immediately took off the five precious ornaments worn by a crowned and anointed king of the kshatriya caste:

At that time, having sat to one side, King MahÄsaá¹ƒmata addressed the Buddha, saying:
Greatly compassionate World-Honored One!

I only pray that the TathÄgata will have pity and instruct me, I only pray that the Well-Gone One will have pity and admonish me, enabling me to realize great meaning, benefit, and peace for a long time.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the great king:
Excellent, excellent!
Great King!
You are now able to ask the TathÄgata about such great meaning.
Great King!
You are now the lord of a great country, you should rule with the right Dharma and not with the wrong Dharma, you should follow the Dharma and not what is contrary to the Dharma.
Why is it so?
Great King, you should know!

If there are kings or rulers who abandon the true Dharma and rule the country with false teachings, they will be criticized by the sages and virtuous ones in the present, will later feel remorse, and after the body perishes and life ends, will fall into the evil destinies and experience severe suffering in the hells;

If a king or ruler abandons false teachings and rules the country with the true Dharma, he will be praised by the sages and virtuous ones in the present, will not feel remorse later, and after the body perishes and life ends, will ascend to the good destinies and be born among the gods, experiencing wonderful bliss.
Great King!
It is just as parents have compassion for their children, always wishing for them to be free from suffering and attain happiness;

The king should also be like this, towards all the beings, servants, workers, ministers, and officials in the country and cities, he should receive them with the four means of unification taught by the Buddhas.
What are the four?
First, giving;
Second, loving speech;
Third, beneficial action;
Fourth, cooperation.
Thus, well-embracing the beings of the country and city, servants, workers, ministers, and officials, embracing the two meanings and cooperating and returning together.
What are the two meanings?
First, the present;
Second, the future.
Great King, you should know!

It is like a man or woman who, in a dream, sees with their mind what they find lovely - gardens, forests, lovely mountains and valleys, lovely cities and various other things. When they awaken from the dream, all that was seen is gone.
Thus, Great King!
The lifespan and body of a kingdom are false and impermanent, all like what is seen in a dream.
Great King, you should know!

The king's wealth, nobility, happiness, self-mastery, and love, as well as all the various enjoyments of desire that he experiences, namely the four divisions of the army such as elephants, horses, chariots, and infantry, the palace, queens, princes, ministers, officials, guards, parents, brothers, sisters, wives, concubines, sons, daughters, young and old servants, the people of the country and cities, gold, silver, precious jewels, pearls, clothing, wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses - all such enjoyments of desire must be abandoned upon death, and one goes to the next world alone, without a single thing following.

The king's wealth, nobility, happiness, self-mastery, and love, as well as all the enjoyments of desire that he experiences, namely the armies of elephants, horses, chariots, and infantry, the palaces, queens, princes, ministers, officials, guards, parents, brothers, sisters, wives, concubines, sons, daughters, young and old servants, the people of the country and cities, gold, silver, precious jewels, pearls, clothing, wealth, grain, storehouses, and so forth - all these enjoyments of desire must be abandoned upon death, and one goes to the next world alone, without a single thing following.

As explained above, all these pleasures are impermanent, unstable, and unreliable. They are all subject to change, fleeting, and do not last. They flow and move, and in the end, they will perish. Moment by moment, they pass away, and later they become ashes. Ultimately, they all end up in the gateway to extinction. They are subject to loss and destruction, have many fears and calamities, and are full of worries and distress. They are all subject to falling, disappearing, breaking, separating, and scattering.
Great King, you should know!

It is like a forest that first sees the blooming of flowers, then the fruits ripen, and later there are no more fruits. First, one sees the leaves lush and green, then they wither and turn yellow, and later they all fall off.
In the same way, great king!

The king's life and wealth, the king's happy state, the king's self-mastery, the king's love and desire, and other beloved pleasures and enjoyments, namely elephants, horses, chariots, infantry, and so on, are all subject to falling, disappearing, breaking, separating, and scattering, and it is the same.
Great King, you should know!
Just as a great bonfire, first seen blazing, then blazing intensely, spreading everywhere, and finally all burning, although blazing for a long time, will eventually be extinguished.
In the same way, great king!

The king's life and wealth, the king's happiness of sovereignty, the king's happiness of self-mastery, the king's happiness of love and desire, and the various enjoyments of desires that he experiences, namely elephants, horses, chariots, infantry, and so on, are all subject to falling, scattering, breaking, and separation, and are also like this.
Great King, you should know!
Just as the sun and moon have great spiritual power and great strength, emitting great light to adorn themselves, illuminating the world, and finally setting.
In the same way, great king!

the lifespan of the king, the happiness of the king's wealth and status, the happiness of the king's freedom, the happiness of the king's desires, and the various enjoyments of desires that he experiences, such as elephants, horses, chariots, infantry, and so on, in detail, are all subject to falling, disappearing, being cut off, destroyed, and scattered, and it is the same for the king.
Great King, you should know!
It is like a great cloud that covers the sky, with violent winds, thunder, lightning, and torrential rain, shaking the heavens and earth, and suddenly dispersing.
In this way, Great King!

The lifespan of the king, the happiness of the king's wealth and status, the happiness of the king's freedom, the happiness of the king's desires, and the various enjoyments of desires that he experiences, such as elephants, horses, chariots, infantry, and so on, in detail, are all subject to falling, disappearing, being cut off, destroyed, and scattered, and it is the same for the king.
Therefore, Great King!

You should diligently cultivate the contemplation of impermanence and the contemplation of cessation and extinction. You should always be alarmed about the end of your own life. As a great king, you should rule with the right Dharma, not with the wrong Dharma, and you should follow the Dharma, not what is contrary to the Dharma.
Great King, you should know!

As the four great mountains come from the four directions, solid and firm, without gaps or openings, filling everywhere, combining into one, reaching up to the sky and down to the earth, all the grasses, trees, branches, flowers, leaves, and sentient beings in between are ground to extinction. It is difficult to escape by force, difficult to resist by power, difficult to stop by spells, wealth, or medicine.
Thus, Great King!

There are four great fearful events in the world that come to destroy all beings, difficult to escape by resolute courage, difficult to resist by power, difficult to prevent by spells, wealth, or medicine.
What are the four great fearful events?
Great King, you should know!
First, old age comes to oppress and destroy a person's youth;
Second, illness comes to oppress and destroy a person's well-being;
Third, death comes to oppress and destroy a person's life;
Fourth, decline comes to oppress and destroy a person's prosperity.
Great King, you should know!
It is like the lion, king of beasts, entering a herd of deer and seizing a deer. Whether it eats it or not, it is at ease and has no difficulty.
At that time, the deer's previous courage, entering the lion's mouth, is no longer able to do anything.
Thus, Great King!
All sentient beings, having entered the mouth of the lion king of impermanence, have no power to do anything.
Great King, you should know!
It is like a person who is brave and has much strength, but is struck by a poisonous arrow, and all his power and fierceness are completely destroyed.
In the same way, Great King!

All sentient beings are stubborn and unruly, but when struck by the arrow of death, they have no power, no protection, no refuge, no place to hide, and are about to abandon their lives. When the limbs and joints are being severed, the blood and flesh dry up, the heart and chest are hot and distressed, and they are tormented by thirst. They open their mouths wide and breathe heavily, their hands and feet are in disarray and unable to function, they have no strength, their saliva and mucus flow, and their bodies are soiled with feces and urine. The six sense faculties are blocked, the throat and palate are choked, and their breathing becomes increasingly rapid. The good doctor gives up and puts down the wonderful medicines.

The delicious and precious food and drink that they have enjoyed, they will all abandon. Lying on a bed, about to go to a different realm, sinking into the boundless, the impermanent torrent of birth, old age, sickness, and death, at the time of death, with little remaining life, due to the power of karma, the next existence will manifest.

Extremely terrifying, the messengers of King Yama, swallowed by the vast dark night, the last of the in-breath and out-breath about to cease, alone, without a second or other companion, turning one's back on this life and returning to the next world.

This is a great shift, entering a great darkness, wandering in a great wilderness, floating on a great ocean, driven by the winds of karma, going to a place without any sign, at that time, there is no other savior, no other refuge, no other place to flee, except for the true Dharma.
Great King!
At that time, only the true Dharma can be their savior, their palace, their refuge, their destination, their hiding place, and can pull sentient beings out of the suffering of birth and death.
Great King, you should know!
It is like a person afflicted by cold, who can only find relief and comfort in warm fire, sunlight, and clothing;
Afflicted by heat, only forests and springs;
If traveling far, only cool shade;
If thirsty, only clear, cold water;
If hungry, only many delicious dishes; If sick, only good medicine and attendants;
If afraid, only strong companions.
In this way, Great King!

All beings, when struck by the arrow of death, have no more power, no more protection, no refuge, no place to flee to. When they are about to give up their lives and their limbs and joints are disintegrating, their blood and flesh dry up, their chest is hot and distressed, they are tormented by thirst, they gape and pant, their hands and feet are in disarray and they are unable to do anything. Speaking in detail, up to that time, they only have the true Dharma that can be their protection, can be their palace, can be their refuge, where they can run to, where they can flee to, and can pull sentient beings out and deliver them from the suffering of birth and death.
Why is it so?
Great King, you should know!

This body, although protected, although washed and adorned for a long time, although satisfied with many excellent foods, when it comes to the end of life, it will inevitably be tormented by hunger and thirst and then give up its life.
Great King, you should know!

Although one may constantly bathe, anoint oneself with fragrant ointments, apply fragrant powders, burn incense, and adorn oneself with flower garlands to one's heart's content, because this body is composed of impurities, when one is about to give up one's life, one will inevitably return to impurity and foulness.
Great King, you should know!

Although one may cover and wrap this body with various excellent and wonderful clothes, because this body is composed of various impure substances, when one's life ends, various impurities will inevitably flow out.
Great King, you should know!

Although one may dwell in a palace surrounded by consorts, court ladies, palace women, beautiful women, and relatives, making various kinds of music and entertainment to amuse oneself, when one is about to die, one will see evil signs and will inevitably be shocked, frightened, sorrowful, and distressed.
Great King, you should know!
Although one may dwell in a palace with painted and decorated halls, towers, pavilions, and windows,
The windows and doors are tightly closed, and various fragrant flowers are used for self-adornment. Various lamps and candles
increase the radiance and illumination. Precious screens and curtains are set up, and various famous fragrances are burned, and
various wonderful flowers are scattered. Fragrant flower treasure vases are displayed everywhere. Various golden, silver, lapis lazuli,
and precious jeweled beds and seats are arranged. The finest woolen blankets, brocade and embroidered cushions, flower carpets, and bedsğŸ”½and seats are set up.
At both ends of the beds and seats, red pillows are placed. They are covered with the finest brocade and embroidered quilts. Sleeping and resting in comfort,
one indulges and becomes attached. After death, one is unaware of anything. The corpse may be sent to a
burial ground, where crows, magpies, vultures, foxes, wolves, wild dogs, owls, and other vicious birds and beasts
compete to eat it. The bones, flesh, pus, blood, beard, hair, and filth flow out onto the ground, and the foul-smelling place is
disgusting.
Great King, you should know!

In this way, the body used to ride on fragrant elephants, swift horses, and various jeweled carriages, beating drums and blowing conches to make great music, with countless jeweled umbrellas following behind, holding fans and whisks to shade and fan, with countless brave and strong elephant troops, horse troops, chariot troops, and infantry troops leading and following in front and behind, defending left and right, with hundreds of thousands of officials wholeheartedly respectfully serving, and the citizens of the city joining their palms in admiration.

Although receiving such supreme and wonderful rewards of self-mastery and glory, before long one will have to close one's eyes, stretch out one's arms, and become motionless, lying on one's back on a bier, to be pulled by many people out of the great city gate. Parents, wife, children, brothers, sisters, servants, attendants, officials, and close relatives will follow to the left and right, their minds entangled in sorrow and their hair disheveled. Raising their hands to beat their heads and chest, they will wail in grief, all saying:
'Alas!
The citizens of the city will mourn upon seeing this.

Following the burial, some leave the corpse exposed for the birds and beasts, where crows, starving dogs, vultures, owls, foxes, wolves, wild dogs, and other vicious animals tear at and devour it, scattering the bones and flesh everywhere, exposed to the wind, sun, rain, and frost, with the limbs disintegrating and falling apart.

Some collect firewood to cremate the body, where the sinews and bones rot, the blood and flesh dissolve, and the foul smoke billows in all directions. After the fire is extinguished, the bones dissolve, the ashes fly away, and the dust scatters.
Some dig the ground to bury the body in a tomb, where after many years the flesh decays and the bones rot.
Great King, you should know!

This body is impermanent, changing and decaying. All sentient beings and conditioned phenomena are like this, not permanent, not enduring, not reliable, all subject to change, swiftly passing, turning and moving, ultimately returning to destruction and cessation. Moment by moment they change and disappear, later becoming ashes and embers. Ultimately they all end up in the gateway of extinction, which is subject to loss, destruction, and fear, with many calamities and sorrows, all falling, declining, breaking apart, and dispersing.
Therefore, great king!

You should diligently cultivate in accordance with the contemplation of impermanence and the contemplation of complete cessation. Do not be tainted by greed and desire, do not be agitated by anger, do not be obscured by ignorance. Do not indulge in the pleasures of the king's wealth and status, do not indulge in the pleasures of the king's self-mastery, do not indulge in the pleasures of the king's love and desire, do not indulge in the pleasures of the various desires and enjoyments that you experience.
You should eliminate the arrogance and indulgence brought about by wealth and life, and you should be fearful of the impermanence of the death demon, which arrives suddenly without warning.

As the ruler of a great country, you should use the right Dharma and not the wrong Dharma, you should follow the Dharma and not what is contrary to the Dharma, you should have compassion for all beings as if they were your only child, you should sincerely uphold the Buddha's teachings, and you should support the Three Jewels without looking back.
Why is this?

In the ocean of birth and death, one wanders without beginning. Only the true Dharma of the Buddha is the great bridge and ferry. It is truly difficult to encounter for thousands and millions of eons.
Great King, you should know!

I never say that obtaining the various pleasures and enjoyments of the world, accumulating and using them, is called being wealthy and noble. I say that obtaining the holy wisdom and treasures of the true Dharma of the Buddhas, accumulating and using them, is truly called being perfectly wealthy and noble.
Therefore, Great King!
One should be disgusted with all the pleasures and enjoyments of the world, and should wish to seek the holy wisdom and wealth of the Buddha's true Dharma.

When the World-Honored One had finished speaking this sutra, the king of Kosala, the lord of the victorious army, and the heavenly beings and others in the world, having heard what the Buddha said, all greatly rejoiced, and with faith and understanding they practiced it.
